REACT.Definition: to act in a particular way as a direct result of something else

MOVE THE CONVERSATION FORWARD.Definition: make the conversation continue or progress

PRETEND.Definition: to behave as if something is true when you know that it is not, especially in order to deceive people or as a game

TURN.Definition: an opportunity or a duty to do something at a particular time or in a particular order, before or after other people

SKIP OVER.Definition: to avoid reading or looking at something

UNLESS.Definition: used to say what will or will not happen if something else does not happen or is not true; except if

ALLOW.Definition: to give permission for someone to do something, or to not prevent something from happening

FACE TO FACE.Definition: used to describe a situation in which you talk directly to another person, not by phone, email, online, etc.

MISUNDERSTOOD.Definition: the past tense of misunderstand - to think you have understood someone or something when you have not

GUARANTEE.Definition: to promise that something will happen or exist

ESSENCE.Definition: the basic or most important idea or quality of something

INFLUENCE.Definition: to affect or change how someone or something develops, behaves, or thinks

SO WHAT?.Definition: an expression that is used to say - it's not important - or - I don't care

YOU FEEL ME?.Definition: A slang expression that means - Do you understand what I’m saying?

REDUNDANT.Definition: more than what is usual or necessary, esp. using extra words that mean the same thing

METHOD TO THE MADNESS.Definition: you have a good reason for what you are doing, although you seem to be behaving strangely

PICK UP ON.Definition: to understand something that is not communicated directly

PRETTY SURE.Definition: to understand something that is not communicated directly

LEADS TO.Definition: If an action or event leads to something, it causes that thing to happen or exist
